intro: Leucosyke benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet leucosyke, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
